data.meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.
data.sentence: The word رَبِّ comes from the root ر ب ب and is associated with the meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.

data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهُ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
The word مَا comes from the root م ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word قَالَ comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
The word وَقَدْ comes from the root ق د and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to do something, He did it, the suffering or receiving the effect of an act, to commit, a doing, to do a deed, a custom/habit/manner/wont.
data.sentence: The word يَفْعَلُ comes from the root ف ع ل and is associated with the meanings: to do something, He did it, the suffering or receiving the effect of an act, to commit, a doing, to do a deed, a custom/habit/manner/wont.

data.meanings: to will/wish. shaiun (pl. ashyaa'un) - thing/matter, affair in any way, at all, what is willed or wished, aught, any extent. In direct objective case it is often used to denote the meaning "a little", "bit", "at all". Adverbially it means "in any way", "at all".
data.sentence: The word يَشَاءُ comes from the root ش ي ا and is associated with the meanings: to will/wish. shaiun (pl. ashyaa'un) - thing/matter, affair in any way, at all, what is willed or wished, aught, any extent. In direct objective case it is often used to denote the meaning "a little", "bit", "at all". Adverbially it means "in any way", "at all".

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word يَكُونُ comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).
data.sentence: The word الْكِبَرُ comes from the root ك ب ر and is associated with the meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).

data.meanings: excited with lust, stirred up, tumultuous, period from birth to the seventeenth year, youth, young man
data.sentence: The word غُلَامٌ comes from the root غ ل م and is associated with the meanings: excited with lust, stirred up, tumultuous, period from birth to the seventeenth year, youth, young man

data.meanings: Reaching, attaining, arriving, coming to the utmost point to which one directs one's course or one who seeks, pursues, desires, intends or tries to reach. Or the reaching, attaining or coming to a point.. An event/time that is premeditated, intended, determined or appointed. Having an effect. Bringing, conveying or delivering communications, announcements, news or tidings. Exceeding usual, proper, ordinary just bounds/degrees, acting egregiously, immoderately or extravagantly. Striving, laboring, exerting power/efforts. Endeavors or ability. Employing oneself vigorously, strenuously, laboriously, earnestly with energy and effectiveness, taking pains or extraordinary pains, not flagging, to the utmost degree. Accomplishing, attaining to the utmost of one's power/ability or efforts/endeavors (e.g. in any affair). Sufficiency (e.g. means of subsistence), a thing that suffices, contents, enables one to attain what is sought, enough. A slanderer, one who conveys gossip or other peoples discourse to others. Calamity, misfortune, disaster, distress or affliction. Sharp, penetrating, eloquent and/or effective in speech. Firm covenants, in the utmost degree. Attaining or having attained puberty, virility, ripeness or maturity. Applied to either sexes. Good, excellent thing. Praise, eulogy or commendation. Place and/or time someone or something reaches, arrives, attains or comes to. The sum/amount/product resulting from subtraction, addition or multiplication. A sum of money
data.sentence: The word بَلَغَنِيَ comes from the root ب ل غ and is associated with the meanings: Reaching, attaining, arriving, coming to the utmost point to which one directs one's course or one who seeks, pursues, desires, intends or tries to reach. Or the reaching, attaining or coming to a point.. An event/time that is premeditated, intended, determined or appointed. Having an effect. Bringing, conveying or delivering communications, announcements, news or tidings. Exceeding usual, proper, ordinary just bounds/degrees, acting egregiously, immoderately or extravagantly. Striving, laboring, exerting power/efforts. Endeavors or ability. Employing oneself vigorously, strenuously, laboriously, earnestly with energy and effectiveness, taking pains or extraordinary pains, not flagging, to the utmost degree. Accomplishing, attaining to the utmost of one's power/ability or efforts/endeavors (e.g. in any affair). Sufficiency (e.g. means of subsistence), a thing that suffices, contents, enables one to attain what is sought, enough. A slanderer, one who conveys gossip or other peoples discourse to others. Calamity, misfortune, disaster, distress or affliction. Sharp, penetrating, eloquent and/or effective in speech. Firm covenants, in the utmost degree. Attaining or having attained puberty, virility, ripeness or maturity. Applied to either sexes. Good, excellent thing. Praise, eulogy or commendation. Place and/or time someone or something reaches, arrives, attains or comes to. The sum/amount/product resulting from subtraction, addition or multiplication. A sum of money

data.meanings: It (food) was wholesome or approved in its result, easy to swallow, not attended by trouble, quick in digesting, light to the stomach, to descend well, to be salubrious in its air (land), in the habit of doing what is approved and shunning what is held base, preserve the soul from filthy actions, to be possessed of manly perfection or manly virtue or moral goodness, give food (on the occasion of building a house or marrying).
data.sentence: The word وَامْرَأَتِي comes from the root م ر ا and is associated with the meanings: It (food) was wholesome or approved in its result, easy to swallow, not attended by trouble, quick in digesting, light to the stomach, to descend well, to be salubrious in its air (land), in the habit of doing what is approved and shunning what is held base, preserve the soul from filthy actions, to be possessed of manly perfection or manly virtue or moral goodness, give food (on the occasion of building a house or marrying).

data.meanings: to cut/wound/slay, hamstrung, produce no result, be barren (e.g. womb).
data.sentence: The word عَاقِرٌ comes from the root ع ق ر and is associated with the meanings: to cut/wound/slay, hamstrung, produce no result, be barren (e.g. womb).
